meanings.definition: To carve, mold, or stamp a design on a surface
meanings.sent1: She used a special tool to emboss her initials on the leather.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to emboss the metal with intricate floral patterns.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to emboss its paw prints on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight seemed to emboss the tree branches against the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The potter carefully embossed the clay vase with delicate swirls.

meanings.sent1: The baker used a cookie cutter to emboss the dough with festive shapes.
meanings.sent2: The tailor decided to emboss the fabric with elegant floral designs.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to emboss the snow with footprints of different animals.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight seemed to emboss the clouds with golden edges.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler skillfully embossed the silver bracelet with intricate details.

meanings.definition: To make a design stand out by raising it above the surface
meanings.sent1: The embossed logo on the book cover caught the reader's eye.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to emboss the painting to create a 3D effect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to emboss its paw prints on the freshly painted wall.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun seemed to emboss the horizon with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor skillfully embossed the marble statue with lifelike features.
